Manuel Augusto R. O. is 57 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are single, in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 6 children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Manuel grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Manuel faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys raising animals, feeding his animals and taking part in carnival celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay day laborers

loans.name: Manuel Elias

texts.es:
Manuel Elias A. R. tiene 50 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos , vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar propiedades para que los hijos sigan sembrando.

Le gusta comprar ganado vacuno para criar y festejar la navidad y el carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Elias A. R. is 50 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grown corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Manuel grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Manuel faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy property so that children can continue to grow crops.  He likes to buy cattle to raise and he likes to celebrate Christmas and Carnaval.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Milton Wilfrido

texts.es:
Milton Wilfrido Q. G. tiene 38 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un poquito de terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte y celebrar el carnaval con la familia y amigos.
texts.en:
Milton Wilfrido Q. G. is 38 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are single, in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grown corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Milton grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Milton faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a small amount of land.  He likes to take part in sports and to celebrate Carnaval with his family and friends.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush V. has been trading in clothing since 1995. Siranush is a widow. After the husband’s death, she gave her property to her son.  Her son lives with his wife abroad and left his mother without a home. Siranush does not own her place and is renting a small place on the city’s outskirts. This hardworking woman with perfect credit history has applied to SEF for a loan to order her pre-Holiday inventory stock.

loans.use: To order inventory stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Celso Jorge

texts.es:
Celso Jorge P. V. tiene 42 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Celso se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para que los hijos tengan patrimonio.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia y jugar boli y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Celso Jorge P. V. is 42 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are single, in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grown corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Celso grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Celso faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house so that he can leave it to his children.  He likes to go out for walks with his family, play volleyball and celebrate fiestas.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay day laborers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cerveza, ella tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Rosa is 64 years old, married and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling beer.  She has a store where she serves from 8.00am to 11.00pm.  Through her business, she manages to get her child ahead in life.

Rosa would like to expand and improve her beer sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy beer wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy beer wholesale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Vilacota, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado. El señor es chofer de transporte publico y su esposa es empleada domestica; así obtienen sus ingresos con los que se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para refacción de la casa donde vive, para vivir más comodamente.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Esteban lives in 'anticretico' (a special rental system particular to Bolivia).  His house is in Vilacota which is an area on the outskirts of the city of La Paz.  He is married.

Esteban is a public transport driver and his wife is a cleaner.  This is how they make the income that they use to support themselves.  

This is the first time that Esteban has requested a loan.  He will use his loan to refurbish his house so that he can live more comfortably.

Esteban's socio-economic profile qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To refurbish his home so that he can live more comfortably

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eusebio Maximo; el tiene 59 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar donde vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y el se dedica a pintar casas es albañil, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer la chicha como maíz. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eusebio Maximo is a member of the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Eusebio Maximo is 59 years old, married and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business which is a bar where he sells 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  He also paints houses and is a construction worker.  He would like to expand and improve his 'chicha' sales business and is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making 'chicha' such as corn.

Eusebio Maximo is pleased to be receiving this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making 'chicha' (a corn-based drink) such as corn

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak S. has been trading in shoes and clothing since 2000.  Arshak is married with two children.  They are living with his mother, his brother and his brother’s family. In this large family, everyone helps each other, at home and in business,  as the income from this business is the household’s main income.  

Arshak is very eager to satisfy his client’s needs, which increase during the holiday seasons. To insure adequate stocks, Arshak has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To order clothing & shoes inventory

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes, ella vende toda variedad de juguetes para mujer y varón la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de juguetes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Roxana is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling toys.  She sells all kinds of boys' and girls' toys and has a store where she works from 9.00am to 8.00pm.  Through her business, she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Roxana would like to improve and expand her toy business and is requesting this loan to buy more toys.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (toys)

loans.name: Janeth Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Janeth A. F. tiene una tienda en el municipio de Puerto Colombia. Esta es una pequeña ciudad costera en la que a principio del siglo veinte funcionó el más importante puerto marítimo del país. La microempresaria es peluquera de profesión y durante muchos años trabajó en varios salones de estética. Hace cinco años su esposo, que era vendedor en un almacén de electrodomésticos, perdió su empleo y fue ahí cuando nació la idea de crear su propio negocio. En un principio el surtido de víveres era pequeño, pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando, al igual que la adquisición de vitrinas, estantes y refrigeradores. Hoy en día la señora Janeth alterna su oficio de tendera con el servicio a domicilio de peluquera. Este es el tercer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertirlo en la compra de víveres en general, siempre se ha distinguido por su excelente puntualidad. El negocio tiene un volumen mensual de ventas de $ 5.000.000 COP y el margen promedio de utilidad es del 20%. La señora Janeth planea para el próximo año alquilar un local más grande para trasladar la tienda y adecuar el sistema de autoservicio. Ella manifiesta que disfruta mucho su actividad de tendera porque le permite estar en permanente contacto con los vecinos de su comunidad, por lo cual, su mayor satisfacción no es la utilidad económica que le genera su microempresa, sino el aprecio que le dispensan todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Janeth A. F. has a store in the town of Puerto Colombia.  This is a small coastal town which, at the beginning of the twentieth century, was home to the most important shipping port in the country.  This small businesswoman is a hairdresser by profession and, over many years, she worked in several beauty salons.  Five years ago her husband, who was a salesman in an electrical appliance store, lost his job and this was when the idea to create her own business was born.

At first, the store was not very well stocked with foodstuffs but, over time, it improved.  Janeth also acquired display cases, shelves and refrigerators.  Now she divides her time between her trade as a shopkeeper and her hairdressing services which she offers in people's homes.

This is Janeth's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest the money in buying general foodstuffs.  She has always been noted for her excellent punctuality.  Her business has a monthly sales volume of 5,000,000 Colombian pesos and her average profit margin is 20%.  Janeth plans, next year, to rent larger premises so that she can transfer her store and adapt the self-service system.  She says that she enjoys her business as a shopkeeper a lot because it allows her to be in permanent contact with the neighbors in her community.  Her greatest satisfaction is not the money that her small business makes but rather the appreciation that her customers all show her.

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Francisco

El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construir como cemento, piedras y pinturas.

Francisco is 47 years old, lives with his wife, and has six children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his work teaching civil construction. He also has a small restaurant which his wife runs. 

Francisco is in the process of building his house and would like to finish building it. He has requested this loan in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, stones, and paint. Francisco is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as cement, stones and paint.

She is glad to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

He is glad to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel Y. V. tiene 61 años. Es soltero, vive con un sobrino, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar más terrenos y comprar una casa.

Le gusta cuidar a los animales y celebrar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel Y. V. is 61 years old. He is single and lives with a nephew in the San Miguel canton in the province of Bolívar. He does not have any children.

The members of the V.R.C. SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the San Miguel canton. They work as farmers to generate a family income, planting corn and a few potatoes and beans.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes. He stocks up in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells his produce at the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay the day laborers. With the support of this loan, he would have the financial help needed to provide for his basic needs. There are challenges to be faced, such as pests and diseases and the changes in climate. It is his dream is to buy more land and a house.

He likes looking after animals and celebrating the carnival festivals.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and to pay the day laborers

José is a farmer.  He grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy some land.  He likes to dance during carnival celebrations.

Alejandrina would like to expand her car washing business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for washing cars.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for washing cars

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 34-year-old mother of three who lives with her family in the rural community of Sarapiqui, Heredia, located in the heart of Costa Rica. 

Viviana is a hardworking woman who has taken it upon herself to engage in a revenue-generating activity to complement the salary she earns working at a local fruit-producing multinational corporation. The company Viviana works for employs many mothers in the area but only offers part-time positions and seasonal, contract work. As a result, the salaries earned by laborers are low, hardly enough to support a family: 150,000 Colones per month (roughly $300).  

Viviana makes up for the low salary she earns by selling various products to members of her community, many of whom she works with. She plans to use this loan to make investments in merchandise such as shoes, clothing and perfumes, which she hopes to sell before Christmas. The loan consultant that has been working with Viviana describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur who has demonstrated her ability to make punctual repayments. 

Viviana has been selling merchandise over the past three years; she has secured a base of regular clients and her business is expanding. Her main obstacle at the moment is a lack of access to working capital. In order to satisfy the existing demands of her clients, she must make merchandise purchases up front, so that she can make sales to her clients on credit. This loan will help to address this obstacle. 

In the mornings, Viviana works at the Tropifrost while her mother takes care of the children. In the afternoons, Viviana is dedicated to her business, making sales, collecting repayments or purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes, clothing and perfumes

He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is not to lose the land that his parents left him as his inheritance.  He likes to feed his livestock.

Telmo works as a farmer and plants corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato, Quito, and San Miguel, and sells his goods at the Thursday market in San Miguel.

Telmo faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, and changes in the weather. His dream is to buy land so that he can continue growing crops.

He enjoys going to mass on Sundays.

La socia es la Sra: Nilda; ella tiene 37 años. La socia es soltera, y se dedica la compra y venta de productos de belleza, ella vende cosméticos por catálogos, la socia trabaja repartiendo sus catálogos y una vez que tiene los cliente y hacen el pedido ella envía la solicitud y pide los productos que le encargaron, la socia desea incrementar sus ventas para ello pedirá los productos que estén en oferta y los mantendrá con ella para ofrecerlos en una siguiente campaña. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta para almacenar hasta la siguiente campaña.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the 'Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco' (Cusco's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Nilda is 37 years old.  She is single and works buying and selling beauty products.  She sells cosmetics through catalogs.  She delivers her catalogs and once her customers have made their orders with her, she sends in her request for the products that they have ordered.  Nilda would like to increase her sales.  She plans to order products that are on offer and keep them safe so that she can sell them to her customers during a later sales period.

Nilda is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying beauty products that are on offer and store them for a later sales period.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy beauty products that are on offer and store them until a later sales period

loans.name: María Felix

texts.en:
María is a 56-year-old mother of five who lives with her husband and son in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural community in central Costa Rica. 

María has a business selling catalog items door-to-door in her community. María dedicates the time she can, usually afternoons, to selling cooking pots and microwaveable plastic containers to acquaintances, friends and neighbors. María hopes to use this loan to make investments in such products. She has been earning a living in this way over the past four years. The only obstacle she faces is a lack of access to working capital funds, which she needs in order to make payments up front for the products she sells to her clients, often on credit. 

María has been a client of Fundación Mujer for a number of years. This, however, will be her first individual loan. In the past, María has demonstrated an exemplary ability to make punctual repayments. She is a caring daughter, mother and entrepreneur, in charge of the care of her mother and, since the beginning of this year, her father as well. Despite her non-business responsibilities, her list of clients is growing and revenues are increasing. This can be attributed to her natural tendency to work hard, and her dedication to her family.

María's main goal is to establish a better way of life for her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of microwaveable containers and cooking pots

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
Carmen Beatriz C. P. tiene 47 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Carmen is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes. She stocks up in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells her produce at the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

She likes to celebrate Christmas and she likes sewing.

loans.name: Maruja

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

Maruja; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, galletas, aceite entre otras, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maruja is 38 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She serves in her store from 5.00am to 10.00pm, selling essentials such as rice, sugar, cookies, oil, etc.  Through this business, Maruja gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her grocery store business.

Maruja is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Reynaldo; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de minero que es un trabajo arduo y muy duro y por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de transporte que utiliza. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un motor para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Reynaldo is 43 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his job as a miner which is very hard work.  Through his work, Reynaldo gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to improve the transport service that he provides.

Reynaldo is requesting this loan to buy an engine for his car.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his car

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como cereales y menestras donde vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales y menestras. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar menestras y cereales al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juan Carlos is 35 years old, married and has three children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling dry products such as cereal and pulses.  He sells his products in Urubamba market from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Through his business, Juan Carlos gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to expand and improve his business selling cereals and pulses.

Juan Carlos is requesting this loan to buy pulses and cereals wholesale.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy pulses and cereals wholesale

loans.name: Mercedes Susy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes Susy; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende todo tipo de telares y mantas hechos en hilo y tela, la socia tiene una tienda donde vende los telares y artesanía y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes Susy is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Mercedes Susy is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She sells all kinds of woven products and blankets made from thread and fabric.  She would like to have a store where she could sell her woven products and handicrafts.  Through her business, she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Mercedes Susy would like to expand and improve her handicrafts business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making her woven products.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making woven products

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgencita de Cancharani” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos (01 independiente), realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, etc.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como labiales, colonias shampoo, tintes, la cual vende a sus amistades y familiares, lo realiza sola, ya que su esposo tiene otro empleo.

Su sueño es superarse en el negocio para tener más ganancias.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la capacitación y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the "Virgencita de Cancharani" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, married and has two children (one of whom lives independently).  She received a high school level education.

Adela has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, etc.

Adela is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in her business selling beauty products such as lipsticks, cologne, shampoo and dyes to her friends and family members.  She carries out her work on her own since her husband has another job.

Adela's dream is to make progress in her business so that she can make more profits.  What she likes about her community bank are the training sessions and the solidarity amongst the members.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón R. hace unos días le dieron  su casa de Infonavit  pero cuando le dieron la casa al Sr. Ramón la casa tenia unos desperfectos el cual el Sr. Ramón esta reparando, el solicita el préstamo para poder impermeabilizar su casa ya que se le germina el agua para adentro, el es una persona divorciada y vive solo, trabaja casi todo el día, es una persona muy perseverante  y se preocupa por salir adelante, el quiere en un futuro hacer su casa a su gusto.
texts.en: Ramón R. was given his house by Infonavit a few days ago (Infonavit is a government program that provides low-cost mortgages to working families so they can buy small starter homes).  However, when they gave him his house, it had some damage which Ramón is working to repair.  He is requesting this loan so that he can waterproof his house because water comes in.   Ramón is divorced and lives alone.  He works almost all day long.  He is a very persevering person and looks after getting himself ahead in life.  In the future, he would like to make his house his home.

loans.use: To waterproof his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE D. URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida y venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz),ella venD. en forma ambulatoria llevando comida y chicha al distrito D. Huayllambamba que queda a unos 10 minutos D. la provincia D. Urubamba, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un restaurant para poder vender la comida y chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "San José D. Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Dominga is 53 years old, married and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food and 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor, carrying her food and 'chicha' to Huayllambamba district, which is 10 minutes from Urubamba province.  Dominga works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She would like to have a restaurant in which she could sell her food and 'chicha'.

Dominga is requesting this loan to buy products for cooking and making 'chicha'.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for cooking and for making 'chicha' (a corn-based drink)

loans.name: Cristo Viene 1, 2, 3, 4 Group

texts.en: L. is the coordinator of his group Cristo Viene (Christ Comes) 1, 2, 3 and 4. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and three of his five children. He enjoys doing business and is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. He has had his business for seven years, starting with a candy and bread stall. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business to buy rice, flour and other foods. He operates a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally colmados are in neighborhoods within short walking distance from any home. He will use the profits to invest in his house and his business. His future plans are to progress and support his family. This Esperanza associate began with us because he wants to improve his business and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. His group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water, none of which is potable, and electricity.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and some canned products

loans.name: Braxides Maruja

texts.es:
Braxides es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” ubicado en el distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 07 hijos (02 independientes), la señora estudió hasta 4º de educación primaria.

Trabaja con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace más de un año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de salteñas, espejos y pomadas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar mercaderías por cajas como peines, pomadas, espejos, etc. trabaja junto con sus hijos y su esposo, también su esposo trabaja  de albañil.

Su sueño es tener un capital propio y que sus hijos salgan profesionales para que no tengan problemas económicos en el futuro.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el préstamo de la cuenta interna y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Braxides is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 38 years, lives with her partner and has 7 children (of whom 2 live independently).  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Braxides has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than one year.  Her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles which she used in her business selling 'salteñas' (a type of Bolivian empanada), mirrors and creams.

Braxides is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy merchandise by the box load such as combs, creams, mirrors, etc.  She works together with her children and husband.  Her husband also works as a construction worker.

Braxides' dream is to have her own capital and for her children to become professionals so that they no longer experience economic problems in the future.  What Braxides likes about her community bank are the internal account loans and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale such as combs, mirrors and creams

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz zona 3 de Mayo. El es chofer socio propietario del trufi 88. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene un hijo. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de motor y realizara la transformación a G.N.V. (gas Natural vehicular) para reducir el costo de gasolina, pues el GNV es mucho más barato. Esto le permitirá mejorar su  ingreso mensual.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro; el estudio de ingresos y gastos indica que Tomas está en condiciones asumir un préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his parents' home which is located in "3 de Mayo" neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  He is a driver who owns his own public transport vehicle and works on a fixed route (88).  This is his main source of income with which he supports himself.  He has one son.

Tomas will use this loan to buy a new engine and convert his vehicle into an NGV (Natural Gas Vehicle) to reduce his fuel costs since natural gas is much cheaper.  This will allow him to improve his monthly income.

This is Tomas' first loan with Impro.  Our study of his income and expenses would indicate that he is approved to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his public transport vehicle and convert it to run on natural gas

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros y llantas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Fanny is 27 years old, single and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vehicle spare parts and tires.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, Fanny manages to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business.

Fanny is requesting this loan to buy tires and vehicle spare parts.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tires and vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de golosinas, ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes todo tipo de golosinas como caramelos, chupetes, galletas entre otros, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria, ella por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to communal bank ¨San Jose de Urubamba¨ which is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Carmen is a 38 year old single mother of two. She alternates her daily activities between buying and selling candy. She distributes to various grocery stores all types of sweets and candy such as caramels, lollipops and cookies, among others. She works as a traveling saleswoman and attributes her success to her kids. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase larger bulk quantities of candy. She is happy for this loan and promises to repay it with interest.

loans.use: Purchasing bulk quantities of candy

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de 37 años de edad, esta casada con Fernando de 40 años y tienen tres hijos, viven en su propia casa construida con material rústico a base de madera, calamina. Su familia es muy unida y juntos quieren sobresalir en la vida. La actividad a la que Alejandra se dedica, es en la atención de su restaurante y al cultivo de  cacao. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para poder cocinar y ofrecer la variedad platillos a sus clientes. Pero los fines de semana se dedican por completo al cuidado de su chacra, ya que mientras más cuidadosa sea sus cultivos, obtendrá mejores granos de cacao al momento de cosecharlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la temporada de cosecha, por que sabe que cuando estén bien maduras y secos los compradores de cacao le ofrecerán mejores precios por su producto. Lleva 18 años trabajando en el campo, sin embargo tiene que cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos que constantemente perjudica su producción. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras para poder sembrar más plantíos de cacao. Este es su 22avo crédito con MFP y  esta dispuesta  a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, contratará jornaleros para que le ayuden a sembrar más plantas de cacao en su parcela, para así obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 37, is married to Fernando, 40.  They have three children and live in their own house made of insubstantial materials like lumber and metal sheeting.  Her family is very united and wants to get ahead in life together.  Alejandra’s activity is a restaurant and cocoa bean farming.

She gets up early every morning to cook a variety of dishes to have available for her customers.  But on weekends they are completely dedicated to caring for their fields because the more care she gives to her crops the better cocoa beans will be produced at harvest.

What she likes most about her work is harvest time because she knows that when the beans are mature and dry cocoa bean merchants will offer her the best prices for her product.

She has been working in the fields for 18 years and must protect her plants from insect infestations that constantly damage production.  In time she’d like to buy more land in order to plant more cocoa bean plants.

This is her 22nd loan with MFP and she is willing to make her repayments on time because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is very well liked by the other members.

She will use the requested 2000 soles to hire day laborers to help her plant more cocoa bean plants in her field in order to obtain more income.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to help her plant more cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Martínez es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado el se ha dedicado a la construcción desde hace muchos años, anteriormente trabajaba solo por su cuenta pero debido a que últimamente se ha estado escaseando el área de construcción tuvo la necesidad de empezar a laborar dependiendo de un contratista, pero  aparte el sigue tomando trabajos independientes los fines de semanas, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, el requiere el crédito para terminar el acabado de su cerca del área de enfrente de su casa debido a que le gusta tener un hogar confortable y bonito para comodidad de el y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Martínez is  hardworking and esteemed man, who has worked in construction for many years.  He used to work on his own but because construction jobs have been scarce recently, he has had to start working for a contractor.  However, he continues to do independent jobs on the weekends.  His wife is a homemaker and cares for their son.  He is seeking a loan to finish the fence around his house so he can have a more comfortable and attractive home for his own and his family's comfort.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a fence

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo menor, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02  años,  su  préstamo  inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el cual compró artículos de perfumería y cosméticos.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, cremas, también hará pavos rellenos por navidad para ello comprara pavos, pollos, frutas, tocinos, jamón, etc., es ayudada por su hermana y su esposo trabaja como taxista.

Su visión a futuro es abrir una tienda, comprar maquinarias y vender productos pre cocidos.
	
Lo que le gusta son las reglas del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” community bank in the district, province, and department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, single, and has a young son, who is in secondary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years.  Her initial loan was for S/. 300.00 new soles, which she used to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

She is asking for a new loan to invest in beauty products, such as lipstick, perfume, powders, creams, and to make stuffed turkeys for Christmas (she needs to buy turkeys, chickens, fruit, bacon, ham, etc.).  Her sister and her husband, who drives a taxi, will help her.

In the future, she hopes to buy a shop, buy equipment, and sell pre-cooked products.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, such as lipstick, perfumes, powders and also other Christmas products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Irama Belén de Achacachi. Ella se dedica a la producción de quesos y su esposo trabaja en la granja de La Salle en Coroico (Coroico es un pueblo ubicado en Los Yungas al norte de la ciudad de La Paz). Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella tiene cuatro hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de vivienda en Achacachi, para estar más cerca de los mercados de venta ubicados en Achacachi.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro; el análisis de sus ingresos y gastos presenta un saldo favorable y la convierte en sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her on house, located in the community of Irama Belén de Achacachi. She dedicates her time to the production of cheeses, and her husband works on a farm called La Salle, in Coroico (a town in Los Yungas, to the north of the city of La Paz). This is their main source of income. She has 4 children. 

She will use the loan to pay for a place to live in Achacachi, in order to be closer to the markets there. This is her first loan from [field partner] Impro; an analysis of her income and expenditure shows that she makes a good living and is a suitable person for the loan.

loans.use: To pay for a place to live in Achacachi, in order to be closer to the market for her produce

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es: La Sra. Angelita V. D. León es una persona muy responsable y cumplida ella sufrió un accidente y quedo pensionada pero aun así no ha dejado D. laborar ella labora en una cafetería D. escuela  desD. hace ya cuatro años, el esposo es guardia D. seguridad D. una agencia privada, ambos siempre al pendiente D. la mejora D. su hogar y seguridad D. sus hijos es por eso que quiere poner la barda D. la parte trasera D. su domicilio debido a que por la parte D. atrás no tiene vecinos y es muy poco seguro para sus hijos.
texts.en: Senora Angelita V. D. León is a very responsible and talented person. She suffered an accident and now receives a pension, but even so she has not stopped working. She has been working in a school canteen for the past 4 years. Her husband is a security guard, employed by a private company. Both of them strive to improve their home and their children’s safety. For this reason that they want to put up a fence at the rear of their house, because there are no neighbours at the back and it is not at all safe for their children.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina,  tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Amadeo de 46 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Marina, es una de las más visitadas, desde las cinco de la mañana abre su tienda de abarrotes en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar los variados productos que vende. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y dispuesta a ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar atender a sus clientes; lleva cinco años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el día. Pero todo esfuerzo es valido, ya que le va muy bien, y gracias a este trabajo obtiene muchos bienes. Con el tiempo espera poder ampliar  su  tienda  y abastecerse de más  mercadería, para así poder ofrecer  a sus clientes  una mejor variedad de productos. Es su 22avo con MFP y  esta dispuesta  a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mi soles solicitados, comprará más productos; para poder implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes y  poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina, age 48, is a hard-working woman who leads a simple life. She lives in her own house together with her husband Amadeo, who is 46, and their 4 beloved children, whom they wish to offer a better standard of living.

Marina’s shop is one of the most visited in the neighbourhood. She opens her grocery store at 5am and waits for neighbours to arrive to buy the goods she sells. She is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman, who always welcomes her customers with a smile and helps them with their purchases. What she likes most about her work is being able to assist her customers. She has had the business for 5 years. She thinks the most difficult aspect is being on her feet all day. But all the effort is worth while, because it is going well and she gets a lot of benefit from this work. With time she hopes to expand the shop and to stock more merchandise, because that way she will be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is her 22nd loan from [field partner] MFP. She likes to make her repayments on time because she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank, where she is well-liked by the other members. With the 3,000 Soles she is looking for, she will purchase more products so she can improve her grocery store and be able to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina Chico en Achacachi. El es productor lechero esta afiliado a Fedelpaz y Aplepo ( federación de lecheros del Departamento de La Paz). La leche que producen sus vacas la vende a la planta industrializadora de leche PIL; así consigue sus ingresos para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos, pero no dependen de su padre. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de ganado lechero. Esto le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socioeconómico le permite ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives in his own house located in Chijipina Chico in Achacachi.  He is a dairy farmer affiliated to Fedelpaz and Aplepo (federation of dairymen in La Paz Department).  The milk his cows produce is sold to the industrial milk processing plant, PIL.  This is how he earns income for family support. He has two children but they do not depend on their father.

He will use the loan to buy dairy cows which will make it possible for him to increase his income.

This is his first loan with Impro and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua T. is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua is a fishmonger in Abura. Akosua uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children. 

She is asking for the loan to purchase additional fresh fish to smoke to increase her business. Akosua plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

At the time of visit, Akosua had sold most of the fish she had smoked for the day.

loans.use: To purchase additional fresh fish to smoke to increase her business

loans.name: Fausta Flora

texts.es:
Fausta es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil viuda, tiene 02 hijos, realizó estudios de educación primaria.

La señora era una socia ahorrista y se reincorpora nuevamente con el Movimiento  Manuela  R., con su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros y a la vez tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que comprará 100 unidades de cuy y gallinas, su hijo lo ayuda en su negocio.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la cuenta interna.
texts.en: Fausta is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" Community Bank in the Puno distruct, in the Puno province in the department of Puno. She is 42 and a widow. She has 2 children and an elementary school education. She saves money and has newly rejoined the Movimiento  Manuela  R.. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she invested in her domestic animal business. She also has a grocery business. Her new loan is for 1000.00 soles, money with which she will buy 100 units of guinea pigs and hens. Her child helps her with the business. Her vision is to improve her business. What she likes about her Community Bank is the ease of getting a loan, and the internal support.

loans.use: to purchase domestic animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is single and takes care of six dependents. She has acquired a junior-high education. 

Ama fries fish in Abura for sale. She uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents. She will be using the loan to purchase extra fresh fish to fry for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: She will be using the loan to purchase extra fresh fish to fry for resale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. sells smoked fish at Abura. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been in this fish business for 15 years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. has a pharmaceutical shop at Abura. Nana has received a senior high education. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more drugs to fill her shop. She wishes to increase her business with the additional income.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to fill her shop.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is married and has five dependants. She has been through senior high school. Abena operates a provision shop at Abura, which she has been doing for 14 years. Her husband is a dispenser. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her goods is increasing and so she is requesting to use the loan to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 32 years old, married and has two children. Currently, two of her children attend school. Her husband is a driver. Fatuma sells cooking oil, rice, salt, fish and vegetables, which she has done for three years. Fatuma will use the loan to add more items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatuma hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raul Vicente; el tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de minería este es un trabajo duro y arduo que necesita maquinarias y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para pagar el contrato de maquinaria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "San Jose de Urubamba" community bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Raul Vincente; he is 51, lives with his partner and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a miner. This is hard and arduous work that needs machinery, and this is how he gets his children ahead. He wants to continue improving in his work. He is requesting this loan to pay the machinery contract. He is happy to have this loan and promises to carry out the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to pay a machinery contract.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique owns a business that sells sugar, mineral water, flours of different products and tomato sauces.  She is 23 years old, married and has one child of three weeks. Her husband is a mason. Angelique has been selling sugar, flours of different products for three years. Her loan will be used to buy more items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for saving to build a house. Angelique dreams of  having a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, mineral water and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Sawuda

texts.en: Sawuda  is 27 years old, married and has one child who is six months old. Her husband works as a farmer. Sawusa owns a business that sells various items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs, onions and more.   She has been in this business for two years.  Her loan will be used to buy more items for sale. Sawuda hopes to use the new profits from her business to renovate her house. She would like to have full contained boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Alexandra

texts.es:
Marlene de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 6 años atrás emprendió su negocio con un pequeño capital. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ubico en la parte delantera de su casa una papelería  (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Inicio el negocio porque su esposo se enfermo y no tenía como ayudar económicamente al hogar. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cuadernos, papelería, plumas etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo artículos para su papelería pero al por mayor como cuadernos, juguetes, plumas. Uno de sus objetivos con el negocio es surtirlo con bastante mercadería y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Marlene, age 31, is a hard-working woman who began her business 6 years ago with a small amount of capital. She lives in an urban zone called Suburbio, and her stationery store is located in the front part of her house (in Ecuador they are called "bazars"). She started this business because her husband became ill and did not have a way of helping the household economically. She currently works from very early in the morning selling notebooks, stationery, quills, etc. She has many aspirations for her business, and for this reason she wants to use the loan to buy wholesale articles for her stationery store, such as: notebooks, toys, and quills. One of her goals with the business is to stock it with enough merchandise and to improve her home.

loans.use: stationery store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is a single parent taking care of three children. She sells Fante kenkey at Abura. (Kenkey is a staple made from boiled maize flour.)  Aba has been selling kenkey for ten years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale on a larger scale. Aba anticipates of using the new profits from her business to educate her children.

In this photo, Aba is showing a few of the kenkey she had made ready to be cooked.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale on a larger scale.

loans.name: Nana Aba

texts.en: Nana Aba E. sells provisions at Abura.  Nana Aba has received senior high education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Nana Aba assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra  tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de acuerdo a la ocasión, actualmente vende CD con canciones y películas, asimismo vende artículos y adornos con motivos navideños, puesto que se encuentra en temporada de fiestas lo cual le asegura buenas ventas. Este trabajo lo realiza sola pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de una prima, disfruta de su actividad porque le permite ser independiente y disponer de sus horaR. para atender a su pequeña hija además de que sus ganancias son mas visibles, su gran sueño es tener un bazar donde pueda vender variedad de artículos para la casa y para oficina. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. El crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que tiene mucho pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 29, lives with her husband in their parents’ house.  For the last four years she has sold seasonal merchandise.  She currently sells music CDs and DVDs as well as Christmas items and decorations since they are in season and generate good sales.

She works alone but occasionally her cousin helps her.  She enjoys the work because it allows her to be independent and manage her own schedules to care for her young daughter as well as producing noticeable profits.  Her great dream is to have a store where she can sell a variety of articles for the home and the office.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are known to her as being responsible and very mutually supportive.  She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the loan she’ll get to buy more merchandise since she has several pending orders to fill.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Martires is the coordinator of her group, Cristo es la esperanza 1, 2, 3 (Christ is the hope). All the members of this group are Haitians and they are located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to give credit to her clients.

Martires is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for 15 years, starting with a small amount of capital that she saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy some canned products, oil cans, and other foods, She operates a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, just a short walk from any home. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save because she wants to buy a small pick up (vehicle). Her future plans are to improve her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because her business needed capital and she found this program very interesting. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

loans.use: To buy some canned products, oil cans, and other foods

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi F. is a fishmonger at Abura. She also cooks food for sale. She is single but takes care of five dependants. She has been in this trade for two years. She is responsible for the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependants. In this picture, Esi is showing some of the plantains she fries and sells.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, de 45 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán donde vive con su esposa y tres hijos: Sarai de 13 años, Katherine de 6 y Keily de 4 años de edad, él tiene un taller de reparación de vehículos desde hace 15 años, es propio  y lo realiza en ocasiones a domicilio, tiene también venta de repuestos, este oficio lo aprendió desde joven y hasta el momento es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta la familia.
Víctor está solicitando un préstamo para  compra de herramientas, llaves y un compresor, con esta ayuda podrá desempeñar el trabajo de una manera más eficiente, agradar a los clientes por el buen servicio y garantizar mejores ingresos para su hogar.
El objetivo de él es cancelar oportunamente este préstamo, generar ingresos para terminar de cancelar un lote y comenzar a construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Víctor, 45, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department with his wife and three children: Sarai, 13, Katherine, 6, and Keily, 4. He has had a car repair shop for the last 15 years.  It’s his own and sometimes he provides in-home services.  He also sells replacement parts.  He learned this occupation when very young and to date is his family’s main source of income.

Víctor is asking for a loan to buy tools, wrenches and a compressor.  With this help he will be able to work more efficiently, please his customers with the good service and guarantee better income for his household.

His objective is to repay the loan on time, to generate income to finish paying for a lot and to start building his own house.

loans.use: To buy tools, wrenches and a compressor.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells sweet doughnuts at Abura. She is single but takes care of three children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to prepare the doughnuts to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make doughnuts

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She sells smoked fish for sale at Abura. She   Ekua has been in this business for eighteen years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used added to buy more fish for sale to expand her business. Ekua plans of reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San  Miguel, se dedica a la venta de bloques para construcción y gas propano, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, este negocio funciona de manera de reventa el proceso es que José compra los bloques  a distribuidores mayoristas para luego revenderlos a los pobladores cercanos.
José en apoyo  a su esposa quiere comprarle una plancha para hacer pupusas y que ella pueda atender un nuevo negocio que lleve beneficios para el hogar, él solicita un préstamo que será invertido en esta compra.
Sueña con ser distribuidor mayorista de bloques, crecer en los negocios y estabilizar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
José lives in the San Miguel department. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages ten and eight.  He works selling cinder blocks used in construction and propane gas.  His business is based on resale in that he buys cinder blocks from wholesale distributors that are to then be sold to local residents.  José dreams of one day becoming a wholesale cinder block distributor, advance in business and achieve stability in the family income.

The loan José is requesting will be used to support his wife by purchasing a grill she can use to make pupusas [a traditional Salvadoran dish].  This will allow her to focus on a new business that will benefit their household.

loans.use: To purchase a grill for making pupusas [a traditional Salvadoran dish]

loans.name: Juana Constantina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos independientes, realizó estudios hasta 3º de educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosina y galletas.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cuál comprará golosinas, galletas y detergentes, lo ayuda su hijo y su sobrina, la señora sale con su negocio a las ferias.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank in Puno district which is in Puno province and department.  She is 58 years old and a single mother of two independent children.  She went up to 3rd grade.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her sweets and cookie selling business.

Her new, 500 new sol, loan will be used to buy sweets, cookies and detergents.  Her son and niece help her.  She takes her business to the market. Her vision is to improve the business.

What she likes about the communal bank is what her savings earn.

loans.use: To buy sweets, cookies and other products, like detergents.

loans.name: Kathlen Marvely

texts.es:
Doña Kathlen, resiD. en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, tienen casa propia y ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, tiene 42 años D. edad, este negocio es D. forma ambulante ofreciendo las prendas D. vestir por las aceras del mercado municipal y sus alrededores D. la ciudad.
Ella quiere aprovechar la temporada buena para vender que es la última semana D. diciembre y solicita la ayuda a través  D. un préstamo para poder invertirlo en prendas D. vestir como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, short, calcetines y bóxer, esta compra será oportuna ya que ha aumentado la demanda D. ropa.
Su aspiración principal son sus hijos, es por ellos por quien ella cada día sale a vender para generar ingresos que solventen sus necesidades y mejoren sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en: Doña Kathlen lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two children. They have their own home, and she works selling clothes. She is 42 years old. She works as a street vendor, offering her clothing items around the municipal market and its surroundings in the city.  She wants to make the most of this good shopping season which is the last week in December and asks for support through a loan so that she can invest in items of clothing such as pants, shirts, tee shirts, shorts, socks and boxers. This purchase will be timely, as the demand for clothes has already increased. Her main aspiration is her sons, for whom she goes out to work every day to generate income to meet their needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, tee shirts, shorts, socks and boxers

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos (02 independientes), la señora realizo estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su  préstamo  inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizo para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta al por menor de ropas para niños.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con la que podrá comprar ropas para niños de primera y segunda mano, sus hijos trabajan junto con su padre en la empresa Cocacola como chofer.

Su visión en el negocio es ser mayorista de abarrotes.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” Communal Bank in the district of Puno, province of Puno and department of Puno. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children (2 independent). She has completed elementary education.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, money which she used to increase capital for her business selling first and second-hand children’s clothing. Her children work with her husband for the Cocacola business as drivers.

Her business vision is to be a wholesaler of groceries.

What she likes about her Communal Bank is the union and what she gains from saving.

loans.use: To purchase and sell children clothing

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis de 27 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde joven le gusto mantener a sus hijos ya que se unió a su esposa muy joven.  Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio ha trabajado como comerciante informal hace varios años.
