texts.en: Mr. Gutiérrez is a very hard-working and humble man.  He started working at a very young age, helping his father on construction jobs.  When he started his own family he continued with the same type of work.  This work allowed him to start building his own house and to buy machinery to install a vulcanizer.  He had always been thinking about starting his own business in the future, so at that moment he started his business.  His son works there as well, and is also a mason.  The business is going well.  Mr. Gutiérrez has been doing this for 15 years now and it is a stable business.  He needs this loan in order to buy necessary materials for his vulcanizer, as well as tires, which he buys in good condition to resell.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Trinia

texts.es:
Trinia es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 7 años de edad. 
Trinia es feriante, todos los fines de semana viaja a la selva de Santa Rosa, Palmapampa, donde vende abarrotes en general y verduras.
A Trinia le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se practica el compañerismo, se intercambia ideas, accede a los créditos y puede ahorrar, aprende de las capacitaciones y lo pone en práctica en su vida diaria. Su sueño es poder crecer en su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Trinia is a member of the Bienestar ["Well-being"] Communal Bank.  She is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are 15, 11 and 7 years old.

Trinia is a saleswoman.  She travels to the jungle every weekend to the markets in Santa Rosa and Palmapampa, where she sells vegetables and general grocery items.

Trinia enjoys meetings of her communal bank because they practice teamwork, exchange ideas, have access to credit and savings, learn practical skills, and are able to put those skills into practice in their daily lives.  Her dream is to be able to grow her business and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries

loans.name: Hector Bartolo

texts.es:
Héctor de 60 años, es un hombre trabajador que ha hecho lo posible para que sus hijos y esposa tengan lo mejor. Comenzó ha reciclar desperdicios hace varios años cuando vio que era rentable venderlos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha podido trabajar comprando y recolectando desperdicios y reciclajes. Trabaja desde muy temprano para poder vender a un buen volumen los desperdicios. El comprar a empresas aluminio, vasos ente otros para venderlos a un mayor valor. 

Uno de sus objetivos es seguir trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus hijos de 11 y 7 años por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar reciclajes y desperdicios. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y que su familia este bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Héctor, 60, is a hard working man who has done everything possible to ensure the best for his wife and children.  He began recycling scraps several years ago when he saw that they were a profitable thing to sell.

Living in an urban area called Orquídeas, he has been able to work buying and collecting scrap metal and recyclables.  He starts working very early in order to sell a good volume.  He buys metal and glass from companies and resells them for a better price.

One of his goals is to continue working in order to provide a good life to his 11 and 7 year-old children, so he would like this loan in order to buy recyclables and scraps.  In the future, he hopes to continue working and for his family to do well economically.

loans.use: to buy recyclables

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: Manuel es un  hombre muy trabajador, casado su esposa de profesión manicurista, hoy en día él trabajo como chofer en una empresa privada, dentro de sus planes esta la mejora de su vivienda para ofrecer protección y seguridad a su familia. No ha encontrado dificulta para que sus planes se realice gracias que con los financiamientos que le hemos ofrecido en afodenic ha sido la herramienta principal para su desarrollo. El préstamo que solicitad es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, playcem, cubeta de pintura, inodoro, puertas y cerraduras. Realizara mejoras en el baño, parte del techo y cambiara las puertas. Atreves de los financiamientos a logrado mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Manuel is a very hardworking man, he is married and his wife works as a manicurist. Manuel works as a chauffeur for a private company. In his plans he wants to improve his home to provide protection and security for his family. Manuel hasn’t had any difficulties thanks to loans that he has received from Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) which has been the main tool for his development. The loan will be used to buy construction materials like: cement, zinc sheets, tiles, beams, paint, a toilet, doors and locks. Manuel will make improvements on his bathroom, part of the roof and will change the doors. With the loans he has been able to improve his quality of life and to have greater comfort in his home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements his home.

loans.name: Kelly Edmita

texts.es:
Kelly es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II, tiene 23 años y es conviviente.
Kelly se dedica la preparación de panes, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina, azúcar, manteca, grageas levadura. La elaboración de panes lo realiza con su pareja y los vende en unos de los principales mercados de Huamanga donde tiene un puesto de venta.
Le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar, tambien porque conoce a mas personas emprendedoras como ella.
Su sueño es poder comprarse un carro para poder repartir sus panes.
texts.en:
Kelly is a member of the “Bienestar II” (Well Being) communal bank.  She is 23 and in a live-in relationship.

Kelly bakes bread.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar, lard, and yeast.  She and her mate bake the bread and she sells it from a stall in the main Huamanga market.

She likes the meetings of her communal bank because she can get loans and she can save because she has met other entrepreneurs like her.

Her dream is to buy herself a car so that she can deliver her bread.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la reparación de cocinas a gas de segunda mano para luego venderlas, su esposo, es quien realiza esta actividad, mientras que ella es la encargada de venderlos en las ferias comerciales de su zona. Los años de experiencia de su esposo  son la garantía de un buen trabajo realizado que minimiza los riesgos, eso le permite mejorar en sus ventas, adicionalmente a esto vende tejidos a mano que ella misma elabora en sus tiempos libres. Ha visto que la venta de cocinas es muy rentable por lo que desea para más adelante  mejorar en sus ventas. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, que son responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de más cocinas para reparar y vender.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and lives at her parents’ home, along with her husband and two children.  She repairs and resells second hand gas kitchen stoves and has been doing so for three years.  Her husband makes the repairs and she makes the sales at various commercial fairs within her zone.

Her husband’s hears of experience are their guarantee of good quality work and low risk.  This allows them to improve their sales.  Apart from this she also sells hand knitted items that she makes in her spare time.  She has seen that the sale of stoves is very profitable and wants to increase her sales in the future.

This will be her eighth loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are people she knows and they are all united and responsible.

She is grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible because it will be very helpful to her.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more used stoves to repair and sell.

loans.use: Stoves for repair and resale

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Geraneos, es separada, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. queso, pan chapa, wawas (pan dulce tipico D. la Región) frutas y preparación D. comidas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. quesos, pan chapla y wawas.
Anataolia se dedica a la comercialización D. quesos, pan chapla y wawas, viaja a Lima ahí los venD. semanal, viaja a Huaral ahí compra frutas que trae para Ayacucho y lo venD. en el Mercado Chorro o a veces venD. las frutas en la heladerías para la preparación D. helados. Cuando Anatolía no pueD. viajar manda los quesos a sus familiares que los distribuyen entre sus caseras.
Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos y pueD. ahorrar y aprenD. en las capacitaciones y comparte momentos gratos con sus consocias.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a member of the Geraneos communal bank.  She is 57 years old, separated, and has seven children.  She sells cheese, bread, wawa (sweetened bread typical of the region), fruit, and prepared food.

She will use the money from the loan she is requesting to buy cheeses, bread, and wawas.  Anataolia travels to Lima weekly to sell her wares.  She also makes trips to Huaral to buy fruit to bring back to Ayacucho and sell in the Chorro market.  Sometimes she sells to ice cream vendors who use it to make frozen treats.  When she can’t travel, she sends the cheeses to her family, who deliver them around their neighborhoods.

She likes her communal bank meetings because she is able to obtain loans, can save money, training, and she can share good times with her friends.

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz, es socia del Banco Comunal Geraneos, tiene 30 años, 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 1½ año, es conviviente
Se dedica a la elaboración de queso y yogurt. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leche.
Mariluz, se dedica a la elaboración de queso y yogurt, su pareja viaja todos los días a Socos y sus alrededores para comprar la leche, trae a Ayacucho y elaboran queso, yogurt, el cual es vendido de lunes a viernes entre sus caseras y los domingos viajan a la feria de Huanta, con el suero de la leche crían chanchos y gallinas que también los venden.
Le gusta Finca porque le dan crédito, puede ahorrar, en las capacitaciones le enseñan como trabajar.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar un carro y poder recoger la leche.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a member of the Communal Bank “Geraneos”. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 10, 7, and 1½).

Mariluz makes cheese and yogurt and will use this loan to buy milk. Her husband travels every day to Socos and the surrounding areas to buy the milk and then brings it back to Ayacucho so that they can make the cheese and yogurt. The products are sold Monday through Friday from her home. On Sundays they travel to the fair in Huanta with the whey produced from the milk. Mariluz and her husband also raise pigs and chickens to sell.

She enjoys FINCA because of the loans, the savings, and the training classes that teach her how to work. Her dream is to save so that she can purchase a car and travel to collect milk.

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Cristo Me Ama 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
R. is excited to be seeking her first loan through Esperanza. She is the mother of six children, four of whom live with her and her long-term partner. To earn a living, she operates a clothing sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. She will save any profits generated as a result of the loan because she wants to buy a house in the future, and her business income is the only means by which she can do so.

R. is a member of the group known as Cristo me ama 1, 2, 3 ("Christ love me"). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugar cane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She thanks you for your support.

Note: the woman pictured in the lower left corner was not visible in the group picture.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ARCO IRIS” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Cascada. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Justina, por la tesorera, la señora Soledad y como secretaria de actas Ericka.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de verduras y macramé, tejido de mantas, ropa de bebé, carnicería y tienda, tienda surtida, venta de coca, tejido de mantas, macramé y ferretería, ladrillos, cemento y estuco.

La señora Justina presidenta de la asociación “Arco Iris”, actualmente tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus cuatro hijos.
La señora Justina comenta que tiene dos negocios, el primero es la venta de verduras los días jueves y domingo en la zona de Villa Mercedes, en su puesto ella vende diferentes tipos de verduras, en esta época de fin de año, en la que se celebran las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo ella indica que hay mayor venta de choclo (maíz), camote y yuca.  El otro negocio es la venta de artefactos como radios, televisores, bicicletas, de manera ambulante, la estrategia es tomar un solo producto e ir a las zonas comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto (la Ceja de El Alto) y exponer el producto hasta lograr venderlo.
Con el crédito de este ciclo la señora Justina indica que comprará verduras para su puesto y radios, televisiones, bicicletas.
texts.en:
The "Arco Iris" ("Rainbow") communal bank is starting out on its first borrowing cycle, and meets in the Cascada community centre. There are 9 members. The bank's committee is made up of the president, Señora Justina, the treasurer, Señora Soledad, and Ericka as secretary. The women's businesses relate to commerce, production, or service industries, and include: selling vegetables and handicrafts, weaving blankets, selling baby clothes, a butcher's shop and grocery, a grocery store, selling coca leaves, making and selling handicrafts, and selling hardware, bricks and cement.

Señora Justina, the president of the "Arco Iris" communal bank, has built a home with her partner and their 4 children. She states that she has two businesses: the first is selling vegetables, on Thursdays and Sundays, in the Villa Mercedes area. At her stall she sells different types of vegetables, and at this time of year, when people are celebrating Christmas and New Year, she reports increased sales of corn, squashes and yucca. The other business is selling goods such as radios, televisions, and bicycles. The way she sells these is to take one single item and go to the commercial districts of the city of La Ceja de El Alto, and expound the item until she succeeds in selling it.

With this loan Señora Justina says she will buy vegetables for her stall, as well as radios, televisions, and bicycles.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, radios, televisions, bicycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sheep and cows.

loans.name: Melvi

texts.es: La señora Melvi se dedica al comercio de productos de plástico ( vasos, bañadores, papeleros, tachos y otros ) productos que los adquiere al por mayor y la señora lo vende al por menor, no cuenta con una caseta,  su venta esta ubicada en una de las calles mas céntricas de  la ciudad de Cochabamba. Su familia esta compuesta por su hija de un año y su esposo, son una pareja muy trabajadora, ella compra sus productos por cantidad y solicito su crédito para proveerse de mercadería ya que estas fechas tienen mucha venta ya que algunas instituciones compran tachos, baldes. Bañeras para los canastos que realizan en fin de año, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Melvi's business is selling plastic products (cups, tubs, wastepaper baskets, garbage cans, etc.)  She acquires her products wholesale and then sells them retail.  She does not have a stall.  She makes her sales on one of the most central streets in the city of Cochabamba.

Melvi's family consists of her one year-old daughter and her husband.  They are a very hard-working couple.  Melvi buys her products in bulk and she is requesting this loan so that she can stock up with merchandise since she sells a lot at this time of year as some institutions are buying garbage cans and buckets.  They also buy tubs for the hampers that they create during this end-of-year period.  She is very grateful to our institution for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy plastic products

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene una casita por la zona D. Wilacota, donD. atienD. el negocio D. venta D. pan, refrescos, abarrotes, etc., ella viva con su esposo y sus hijos menores que están en edad escolar, el esposo es albañil, quien tiene contratos por los Yungas muchas veces y en otras por la zona sur, ella saca montos pequeños, para compra D. mercadería y para la venta D. verduras, ya que paralelamente a esa actividad ella tiene un puesto D. verduras en el mercado 29 D. enero D. Chasquipampa, productos que trae D. su pueblo que es Totorani y D. Rio Abajo, es una cliente muy cumplida. por lo que anteriormente también fue cliente Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena has a small house in the Wilacota area where she also runs a store selling bread, soft drinks, groceries etc. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is a builder who works often in the Yungas area and also in other parts of the south.

Filomena takes out small loans to buy merchandise. She also sells vegetables in Chasquipampa’s January 29th market.  She transports the produce from her village of Totorani and the Abajo river. Filomena is known to be a very responsible person; she has worked with Kiva previously.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Yene

texts.es: Yene tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene, es una tienda, y desde hace 15 años que se dedica a ella, en este trabajo una de sus hijas la ayuda en la atención, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, asimismo golosinas y bebidas gasificadas.  Su negocio es muy rentable, puesto que se encuentra ubicado en una zona donde hay mucha afluencia de gente, ya que cerca hay un centro educativo y una universidad, es por ello que tiene ventas frecuentes. Se siente muy contenta de tener ingresos diaR., es por ello que desea mejorar el ambiente de su tienda y ampliarla. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para incrementar con más mercadería para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
45-year old Yene lives with her two daughters in her own house. She has run her store for 15 years helped by one of her daughters. She sells basics as well as candy and pop. Her business is very profitable as it is located in a busy area of town--there’s an education centre and a university nearby so she has lots of customers. 

Yene feels very happy to have a regular income, and for this reason wishes to renovate and expand the store. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is pleased to know that she has this financial assistance. She is also grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are people she knows, and all are responsible and committed.

Yene also wishes to thank all those people who donate money towards the loan she is seeking since it will help her greatly to make financial progress. With the loan she will buy more stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo Group

texts.es: Doña Santa Pascuala C. A., tiene 30 años D. edad, soltera, no tuvo oprtunidad para estudiar pero se ha esforzado para apoyar económicamente asu familia, se dedica a una tienda D. comsumo general, empezó con un pequeño ahorro y ahora ya tiene 8 años con este negocio y tambien se dedica a la crianza D. animales con lo que tiene 5 años D. experiancia, le va bien pero desea aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Contando con ese entusiasmo deciD. reunir a otras 9 compañeras para formar un banco comunal con el proposito que cada una D. ellas logre contar con un capital D. trabajo y para las que ya tienen un negocio incrementarlo, cada una D. las integrantes del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades productivas las cuales mencionamos: crianza D. animales, confeccion D. pantalones, tejido D. sabanas, tienda D. consumo diario y venta D. helados. Esperan que con este prestamo logren alcanzar su objetivo D. aumentar su negocio e incrementar sus ganacias, Doña Santa Pascuala sueña con ver una tienda granD. y surtida para poder atender D. la mejor manera sus clientes.
texts.en:
30-year old Doña Santa Pascuala C. A. is single. She did not have the opportunity to go to school as she had to earn money to help her family. She runs a general store which she opened using a  small amount of money she had saved. She’s had this store now for eight years. Santa Pascuala also has five years of experience raising animals. All is going well for her, and for this reaS. she wants more money to invest in her businesses.

Enthusiastically she and nine friends decided to form a community bank so that each could get a loanl. Those already with businesses would invest in them. Each member of the group has a different kind of work such as raising animals, making pants, making sheets, running a general store, and selling ice cream. They hope to achieve their goals of expanding their businesses and increasing income through this loan. Doña Santa Pascuala’s dream is to have a large, well-stocked store so she can proviD. better service to her customers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Manzanitas” está iniciando su ciclo número uno en el Centro Focal de Senkata. Cuenta con ocho integrantes.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de juguetes, costura de polleras, juguetes, venta de queso, venta de verduras, salchipapas, venta de papa, tejido de mantas.

La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Julia, la tesorera, la señora Marcelina y como secretaria de actas la señora Martha. Muchas de las señoras indica que ya tiene experiencia en trabajar con crédito y también comentan que entre ellas se conocen bien, por lo que tienen la confianza de concluir con éxito este ciclo. 

La señora Julia, presidenta de la B.C. “Manzanitas”, tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus tres hijos.  Hace varios años su hermana le enseñó a comerciar con papa y carne de cordero, comprando de poblaciones cercanas a la ciudad de El Alto y vendiendo en Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.  Sin embargo, debido a la época de navidad la señora Julia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de juguetes por que la demanda de estos  se incrementará.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la respuesta es “el consultorio gratuito”.
texts.en:
Manzanitas Communal Bank is beginning its first cycle in Centro Focal de Senkata. There are eight members. The businesses of these women are in merchandise, production and service: toy sales, sewing traditional dresses, toys, cheese sales, vegetable sales, sausages, potato sales, and sewing tablecloths. The directors board is made of the president, Julia, the treasurer, Marcelina, and as secretary, Martha. Many of the women say that they already have experience working with loans and also say that they know each other well, which gives them confidence that this cycle will end successfully. Julia, president of the B.C. “Manzanitas” has a household made up of her partner and her three children. Several years ago, her sister taught her the business in potatoes and pork, buying from people in the outskirts of the city of El Alto and selling in the markets of the city of El Alto. However, due to the Christmas season, Julia wants to invest this loan in the purchase of toys because the demand for them has grown.

When she is asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, the answer is, “the free advice.”

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: Lupe Jazmin

texts.es:
Lupe de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que con dedicación y  ayuda de su esposo han podido mantener su hogar. Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ha trabajado con el empuje de su mama que desde que comenzó su negocio la ayuda dándole ánimos e incentivándola para que lo ubique en un mercado cerca de su casa. Ya tiene un año con el puesto de venta de bisutería y ropa trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 14h00pm vendiendo ropa, bisutería a un bajo costo. 

Quiere continuar ayudándole a su esposo con los gastos familiares por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar ropa y bisutería. En el futuro uno de sus objetivos es que su familia se encuentre unida y seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder agrandarlo.
texts.en:
Lupe is 34 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who, through commitment and the help of her husband, has been able to support her household.

Lupe lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  She has always had her mom's support and encouragement.  Since she started out in her business her mom has helped her, providing her with encouragement and motivating her to set up her business in a market near her home.  Lupe has had her sales stall where she sells costume jewelry and clothes for one year.  She works from 8.00am to 2.00pm selling clothes and costume jewelry at low prices.  She would like to continue helping her husband with their family expenses.  She needs this loan to buy clothes and jewelry.

In the future, Lupe's goals are for her family to be united and to continue working in her business and be able to expand it.

loans.use: To buy clothes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde entonces aprendió todas las técnicas agrarias, hoy junto a su esposo cultivan papa; asimismo cría y venden animales menores como: cuyes, de las cuales son vendidas en las ferias ganaderas de su zona. Ella considera rentable, la venta de cuyes, pues obtiene ingresos mas frecuente; ya que para obtener los beneficios que le deja la agricultura debe esperar meses para poder cosechar sus productos. Por lo pronto seguirá intensificándose en la siembra, así como aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene actualmente. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, asimismo contratará peones para que le ayuden en la siguiente campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Angélica, 22, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Since she was a little girl she has been farming; she learned all the farming techniques back then.  Today, together with her husband, she grows potatoes and also raises small farm animals like, guinea pigs that are sold at the local livestock markets in her area.  She considers guinea pig sales profitable because income is more frequent whereas she has to wait several months until harvest time to get benefits from farming.  For the time being, she will continue to strengthen her crops as well as increase the number of animals she has.

This is her loan #2 from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people she knows.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use it to buy sacks of manure as well as hire laborers to help her with the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and hire laborers to take charge of the planting.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Del Progreso Group

texts.es: Hilda R. pertenece al grupo “SARITA COLONIA DEL PROGRESO”, tiene 34 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores D. edad. Su negocio es la venta D. desayunos en su casa, el cual se inicio después D. haber trabajado muchos años como empleada del hogar y no tener el tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a sus hijos. Trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante, su actual negocio  le permite tener mayor dedicación a su hogar y a la vez contribuir con los gastos principales D. la educación y alimentación D. sus hijos, apoyando D. esta manera a su esposo. A la vez este negocio le permite ahorrar ya que su  meta es apoyar a su esposo  en la construcción y acabado D. su casa para tener mayor comodidad  tanto ella como su familia. El préstamo solicitado le permitirá invertir en su negocio ampliando su espacio y poder atender mejor a sus clientes asegurando así sus ganancias para cumplir su meta mencionada.
texts.en:
Hilda R. belongs to the “SARITA COLONIA DEL PROGRESO” group.  She is 34 years old, married and has three dependent children in her care.  Her business is selling breakfasts from her home.  She set up her business after having worked as a cleaner for many years, during which time she did not have sufficient time to spend with her children.

Hilda R. works as a cook in a restaurant.  Her current business allows her to spend more time looking after her household and also allows her to contribute to her main expenses which are educating and feeding her children.  In this way she can support her husband.  At the same time, this business allows her to save since her goal is to support her husband in building and putting the finishing touches to their house so that both herself and her family can live more comfortably.  

The loan she is requesting will allow her to invest in her business, expanding her space and being able to better serve her customers, thereby guaranteeing her profits so that she can fulfil her aforementioned goal.

loans.use: To invest in her business, expanding her space

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.es: El señor Ireneo nacido el 12 de febrero en Chuquisaca vive con la Sra. María  con 3 hijos, hoy tiene sus tierras en alto espejo. Vive en la misma parcela donde trabaja agricultura pero también tiene su camión tiene su línea que hace servicio forestal, el siembra, arroz, yuca, Maní y también se dedica a la crianza de Chanchos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra y en la compra de cría de Chanchos, todo lo que el cosecha lo comercializa en el  mercado de El Torno, y su camión le ayuda en transportar su mercadería al mercado, es muy trabajador y responsable, trabaja toda la familia unida, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Ireneo was born February 12 in Chuquisaca, he lives with Mrs. María and their 3 children, and he has his land in alto espejo. He lives in the same plot where he works as a farmer but he also has a truck and has a route that has a forest service; he grows rice, yucca, and peanuts and also raises pigs. The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds for his crops and to buy pigs to breed, everything that he grows he sells in the El Torno market, and his truck helps him to transport his merchandize to the market. Mr. Ireneo is a very hardworking and responsible man, the whole family works united and is very grateful to the institution for all the support given to them.

loans.use: For his rice crops and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Dunia Mayela

texts.es:
Dunia es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, iniciando  desde joven al comercio para equilibrar los gastos de la familia.
Cuando comenzó lo hizo con pocos ahorros que su compañero dio, lo que vino a reforzar su inventario con préstamos que Afodenic dio mediante el financiamiento a plazo. Obteniendo mejores resultados de venta como la captación de clientes.
También a través de estos préstamos está mejorando su vivienda, lo que para ella es de gran satisfacción. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, soldadura,  diluyente, para cambiar el techo de la cocina. Logrando una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Dunia is a small business owner who sells clothing, shoes and from a very young age she has had a trade to help meet her families’ needs.

When Dunia began her business, she started with very few savings that her partner gave her and she used them to stock her inventory and with the loans from Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) given to her in a previous loan. Dunia has had better sales and more customers.

Dunia has also been using the loans to make improvements to her home which gives her great satisfaction. With the new loan she will buy zinc sheets, tile, solder, and solvents to change her kitchen’s roof. This will allow her to have a better home.

loans.use: She will change her kitchen’s roof and will buy zinc sheets, tile, soldering, and solvents to change her kitchen’s roof. This will allow her to have a better home.

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es: Mariana Muñoz tiene 47 años y tiene 3 hijos,  dos D. ellos son mayores D. edad y solo uno  es menor D. edad y esta a su cargo. Vive en la zona D. Enace y pertenece al grupo “MANOS TELARAÑAS”. Este grupo es parte D. una organización D. tejedoras que se dedican a la enseñanza D. tejido, donD. Mariana también forma parte, por ello su negocio principal es el tejido al cual se dedica casi 3 años. Ella se inicio por iniciativa propia al tener su último hijo y querer hacerle sus propios ajuares. Visitó un lugar donD. le enseñaron y luego con unas amigas fueron practicando y especializándose en los acabados formando su organización y empezaron con las ventas a sus conocidos y familiares resultando algo rentable para su economía, ya que con ello apoyaba al esposo  a cubrir los gastos principales del hogar e incluso frente a los problemas económicos que el esposo atravesó por un momento pudo suplantar todos los gastos familiares. Su gran meta es poder exportar sus productos para lo cual invertirá el dinero solicitado.
texts.en: Mariana Muñoz is 47 years old and has 3 children, two of them are grownup and only one is underage and under her care. She lives in the Enace area and belongs to the “Manos Telarañas” (“Spider web Hands”). This group is part of an organization of weavers who teach weaving of which Mariana is also a part of which is why her main business to weave which she has been doing for almost 3 years. She began the business by her own initiative when she had her last son and wanted to make his baby clothes. She visited a place where they taught her and later with some of her friends they practiced and specialized in making them especially in their finishing touches. They later formed and organized and began to sell their items to people they knew and family and realized that it was profitable since with it Mariana was able to help her husband meet the household expenses when her husband went through some financial problems. Mariana’s goal is to be able to export her products to which she will use the money loaned.

loans.use: To buy merchandize to export.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Jina I.  tiene 53 años, es  madre soltera y tiene  7 hijos mayores de edad a quienes ha criado y educado bajo su propio esfuerzo  y dedicación, vive en Puente Piedra y pertenece al grupo “Nuevo Amanecer”. Desde que llego a Lima, hace mas de 30 años  de su tierra Iquitos,  inicio su negocio ofreciendo condimentos, que ella misma compraba y empaquetaba,  a diferentes mercados de su distrito. Poco a poco sus ventas se fueron incrementando y fue invirtiendo más  logrando colocar su mercadería a mercados más lejanos a su distrito. Con estas ventas pudo arreglar su casa que lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Actualmente se siente feliz de ser parte de este grupo ya que, ello le permite contar con un capital de trabajo para poder incrementar su negocio y lograr ahorrar para poder adquirir un puesto propio donde pueda implementar  con mejores espacios y comodidad para su trabajo. El reciente préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: Jina I. is 53 years old, is a single mother and has 7 adult children whom she has taken care of and educated through her own hard work and dedication. She lives in Puente Piedra and belongs to the group “Nuevo Amanecer” (“New Dawn”). Ever since Jina arrived in Lima over 30 years ago from Iquitos, her homeland, Jina began selling seasonings that she bought and packaged, and sold to different markets in the district. Little by little, Jina’s sales increased and she invested more in her business and was able to sell her merchandize to markets more distant from her area. With the sales, she was able to fix her home which she obtained with a lot of hard work to give greater comfort to her children. At present, Jina is happy to be a part of this group since she is able to have work capital to be able to keep expanding her business and save enough to be able to have her own stall where she can work with more space and comfort for her job. The loan will be used to buy merchandize for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her business.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio tiene 28 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas es así que en la actualidad siembra papa, maíz, arveja, habas, mashua entre otros productos. Su esposa es su principal ayuda en estas tareas. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, adquiriéndolos a un menor precio, luego de un tiempo los engorda y los comerciales a un precio mayor, así puede generarse ganancias mientras espera la cosecha de sus productos. Todas estas actividades le han servido para sostener a su familia y considera rentable la venta de animales sin embargo seguirá dedicándose a la agricultura porque llega a tener ingresos en mayor cantidad después de esperar por varios meses y eso le favorece para incrementar mas su capital. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, aunque como socio pasivo de su grupo estuvo anteriormente esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono, para poder mejorar la producción de maíz.
texts.en: Dionisio is 28 years old; he lives in his own home with his wife and 2 children. All of his life he has been tied to agricultural work and presently he grows potatoes, corn, peas, broad beans, and mashua (an edible tuber, which is eaten as a root vegetable) among other products. His wife is his main source of help. Dionisio also raises small animals by getting them at a less price and after some time he fattens them up and sells them at a higher price and is able to have greater earnings while he waits for the harvest of his products. All of these activities have helped him support his family and considers that selling animals is more profitable but still works as a farmer because it helps him have more revenue after having to wait for several months. This is first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) even though he has been an inactive member of his group but now is happy to know that he has financial support. Dionisio is grateful to those people who will help him with his loan since it will be very helpful for him to progress in his job. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and manure to be able to improve his corn production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre dedicada a su familia, comerciante de ropa y cosmético con tres años en las ventas.
Ha sido muy trabajadora pues ha tenido que apoyar a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre. Ha trabajado en varios trabajo de domestica, y fue con su liquidación que comienza a comprar productos de cosmético el cual se afilia a la empresa Avon, en donde sus productos son buenos y accesibles al bolsillo del cliente.
Para ofrecer más productos y obtener mejores resultado de ganancia busca una alternativa de financiamiento el cual lo hace a través de Afodenic. Lo que viene ah dar mejores resultado. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: una variedad de cosmético en cremas, pintura de labio, vanidad, perfume de dama y caballero, zapatos y sandalias. Siendo el 50 por ciento de encargo por catálogos.
texts.en: Mirtha is a mother dedicated to her family. She has sold clothing and makeup for over three years. She has been a very handworker since she has to take care of her children since she doesn’t have the support of the father. Mirtha worked in different housekeeping jobs and with her severance pay she bought makeup from Avon where the products are good and accessible for her customers. To be able to offer more products and have greater earnings, she looked for a financing alternative through Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner), which has given her greater results. With this new loan she will buy a variety of makeup in creams, lipstick, perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, shoes and sandals among other items. 50 percent of her sales are made through catalogues.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, sandals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maribel Ynes

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años, de estado civil soltera, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cuál comprará ocho cajas de manzanas, uvas, plátanos, naranjas y piñas, los cuales se venden en el mercado de Bellavista  junto con mamá.

Su sueño es alcanzar sus metas relacionados a su carrera de Turismo.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” Communal Bank in the district of Puno, province of Puno and department of Puno, she is 22 years old and single, she has a higher education.

Maribel has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years, her first loan was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles and she invested it in her fruit stand.

Her new loan is of S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, she will use it to buy eight cases of apples, grapes, plantains, oranges and pineapples, which are sold in the Bellavista market with her mother.

Maribel’s dream is to reach her goals related to her tourism degree.

What Maribel enjoys about her Communal Bank is its punctuality, responsibility and solidarity.

loans.use: To buy different quantities of fruits like apples, oranges, pineapples and others.

loans.name: Leidy Rocio

texts.es: Leydy Roció R. de 27 años trabaja comercializando  carnes frías y desde que terminó sus estudios de bachiller  cuando apenas tenia 19 años y adquirió la disciplina de trabajo como secretaria de un abogado por 4 años, luego fue manicurista  por 2 años  y como sus aspiraciones siempre han sido muy grandes, cuando trabajó en una reconocida empresa de fabricación y venta de carnes frías inició su emprendimiento con estos productos, aprovechando el buen precio que le otorgaban y además porque estaba muy cerca a las ofertas. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con este su credikiva comprará productos especiales para la temporada como pavos, jamón, salchicha y otros embutidos. Leydy vive con su cónyuge  en el barrio 20 de Julio al suroccidente de Barranquilla y tiene un hijo en la edad de 2 años, con el que sueña brindarle bienestar para que tenga un futuro exitoso. El negocio de carnes frías de leydy reporta una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 16 días, una rotación de inventario de 11 días, el endeudamiento actual es del 3% y su capacidad de pago de un 97%, mientras la rentabilidad sobre las ventas de de un 33%. Leydys es una mujer muy especial que se esfuerza cada día por ser mejor madre y en general muy buen miembro de familia.
texts.en:
Leydy Roció R., 27, works selling cold cuts and since finishing high school when she was just 19 years old she acquired work discipline working as a secretary for a lawyer for four years.  Then she was a manicurist for two years.  Since she’s always had big dreams when she worked for a renowned cold cut manufacturing firm she started an enterprise using these products taking advantage of the good price they gave her and her proximity to specials.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with this Kiva loan she will buy special seasonal items like turkeys, ham, sausage and other cured meats.

Leydy lives with her spouse in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in southwest Barranquilla.  She has a 2 year old son for whom she dreams of providing wellbeing so that he will have a successful future.

Leydy reports a 16 day rotation in accounts receivable, an inventory turnaround of 11 days.  Her debt is 3% and her payment capacity is 97% while her profits on sales is 33%.  Leydy is a very special woman who strives daily to be a better mother and in general a better family member.

loans.use: To buy special seasonal products like: turkeys, ham, sausage and other cured meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fans, blenders, sheets and drugstore goods

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz H. de 34 años que vive en el barrio la Chinita con su conyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años . Desde hace 15 años se dedicò a la elaboraciòn de cojines  y desde hace 5 su esposo adicionò la venta de cerdos  los fines de semana , en base a estos trabajos Diana y su esposo han planeado toda su vida con el fin de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una eduacion de calidad que asegure un futuro exitoso. El sueño de Diana es lograr adecuar su vivienda completamente y esto lo lograrà afianzado su negocio de la mano de su esposo y apoyada por los financiamientos de la Fundaciòn Santo Domingo, organizaciòn en la que esta aplicando a su primer financiamiento, asì con su credikiva comprarà materia prima para elaborar cojines de la època navideña de los que tiene ya pedidos  y quiere atrasar su entrega, asi mismo invertira en la compra de cerdo de contado, porque en las fiestas navideñas este es el insumo principal de todas las comidas especiales y diana Luz y su esposo aprovecharàn este buen momento que tendrà su negocio llamado : “Venta y elaboraciòn de cerdos y cojines, la bendiciòn de Dios”
texts.en:
Diana Luz H. is 34 years old.  She lives in La Chinita neighborhood with her husband and two children aged 9 and 12.

She has been making cushions for 15 years.  5 years ago, her husband also started selling pigs on weekends.  Through their work, Diana and her  husband have managed to get their children ahead in life and offer them a good-quality education that will guarantee them a successful future.

Diana Luz' dream is to manage to completely remodel her home.  She will achieve this by strengthening her business, with her husband's help, and also with the support of loans from Fundación Santo Domingo.  She is requesting her first loan from the organization.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy materials for making Christmas cushions for which she already has orders and whose delivery she has delayed.  She will also invest in making a cash purchase of pigs because during the Christmas period this is a key ingredient for all the special meals that people make.  Diana Luz and her husband will take advantage of this good moment for their business called : "Sale and production of pigs and cushions: God's blessing".

loans.use: To buy materials for making Christmas cushions for which she already has orders and has delayed their delivery.  To also invest in making a cash purchase of pigs

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: En el Restaurante la “La Flaca” Claribel venD. diariamente desayunos, almuerzos que compran sus vecinos en el barrio 7 D. abril en un llugar con un ambiente combinado D. viviendas, gasolineras, micronegocios  y hasta empresas. Claribel vive con su conyuje y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 15 a 18 años y con este ingreso ha logrado apoyar la gestion del hogar, complementando lo que su marido lleva a casa, para sacar adelante esta familia. DesD. muy niña, cuando procedente del municipio D. Bellavista, en el departamento del Magdalena, tuvo que trabajar ; al principio se alojò donD. su tia y se empleò como domèstica,  hasta la edad D. 24 años;  hoy 20 Aaños despues sabe que todo estò fuè una gran experincia que forjò su carácter para que generara emprendimientos D. negocio, primero fue con el queso , suero, mantequilla y bollo, como para no olvidar su tierra natal donD. se preparan los mas deliciosos làcteos, acompañados con los amasijos D. maìz  y finalmente teminò desarrollando un pequeño restaurante  cuando ya pudo comprar una casa y lo ubicò en ella. Su negocio està muy estructurado fisicamente posee sillas, mesas que dan comodidad a sus clientes; en estos ultimos dias ha pensado en comprar una vitrina calentadora que cuesta $340.000 COP, y como venD. 50 almuerzos diarios y 200 fritos, tambien està requiriendo materias primas en mas volumen porque sabe que sus ventas aumentaràn en el final del año; esta es la razòn D. solicitar su crediKiva, que es su credito nùmero 15 con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organizaciòn con la que ha crecido D. su mano, tanto a nivel D. su negocio,  por los financiamientos recibidos, como por sus proceso formativos que le han ayudado mucho. Ella dice que este es el negocio con el cual ha soñado, pero cada dia desea fortalecerlo para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la educacion.  Su sueño es darse unas vacaciones con su esposo en SAn Andres Islas, un bello lugar donD. la playa, brisa  y el mar le haràn descansar su cuerpo y su mente y serìa su segunda luna D. miel a sus 44 años D. edad.
texts.en:
In the restaurant "La Flaca" Claribel makes breakfast and lunch daily that she serves to her neighbors in the April 7th neighborhood, a place that has a combination of residences, gas stations, small businesses and larger companies.  Claribel lives with her husband and has 3 children between the ages of 15 and 18.  Her income, along with her husband's, has been able to support her household and her family.  

Since she was a young girl from the town of Bellavista in the department of Magdalena, she has had to work.  In the beginning she stayed with her aunt and worked as a domestic employee until she was 24 years old.  Now, 20 years later, she knows that all this was a great experience that forged her character so that she would be able to venture into business for herself. Her first business was making cheese, whey, butter and bollo [a tamale like dish] in remembrance of her homeland.    She prepares the most delicious dairy products served with amasijos D. maíz [corn tortillas].  Lastly, she finished setting up her small restaurant when she was able to buy a house and establish it there.  For the comfort of her customers she has tables and chairs and recently, she has been considering buying a heated case that costs $340,000 COP because she sells 50 lunches and 200 fried items daily.  Also, she needs large quantities of raw materials because she knows that her sales will increase at the end of the year.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan. 

This will be her 15th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has supported her from her humble beginnings, as much at the business level through the loans she has received, as through the training that has helped her immensely.  She says that this is the business that she has dreamed of, but every day she wants to strengthen it so that she can continue supporting her children's education.  Her dream is to take vacations with her husband to the San Andres Islands, a beautiful place where the beach, the breeze and the sea will allow her to rest her body and mind and will be a second honeymoon at 44 years old.

loans.use: To purchase a heated case and raw materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años, de estado civil soltera, la señorita en la actualidad sigue estudiando.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de producción de mana.

Solicitara un nuevo crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprará fideos, trigo, azúcar y maíz para su producción de mana, trabaja junto con sus padres.

Su visión en el negocio es independizarse, tener su propia maquinaria y poner una tienda.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y lo que gana.
texts.en:
Mirian is a member of the May 3rd II Communal Bank in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 20 years old and single. This young lady is currently continuing her education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four months. Her first loan was for 300 PEN and invested in her business of making “mana” (a type of candy dough).

Mirian is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 PEN in order to buy pasta, wheat, sugar, and corn used in making “mana”. She and her parents work together.

Her vision with her business is to become independent, have her own machinery, and establish a store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the interest she earns.

loans.use: Purchase pasta, wheat, sugar, and corn

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja más de 08 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su  préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de venta de gaseosas, actualmente también tiene una Botica.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará medicamentos para su Botica 30 cajas de pastillas, 50 unidades de termómetros, algodones, etc. lo vente en Ilave y lo realiza sola.

Su sueño es crecer en el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the May 3rd II Communal Bank in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, single, and does not have children. Natalia completed her higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN and invested in her business of selling sodas, but she currently owns a pharmacy.

Natalia is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PEN and will use the money to buy medicines for her pharmacy. These include 30 boxes of pills as well as 50 thermometers, cotton, and other supplies. She sells in Ilave and works by herself.

Her dream is to grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase medicines, thermometers, cotton, and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Desde hace 02 años trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, con su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio confección de ropa deportiva.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en telas, hilos y cierres, la señora vente buzos, camisetas, polos, trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión en el negocio es tener más maquinarias, una empresa de confección de buzos.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the May 3rd II Communal Bank in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two dependent children. Rosa completed her higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN and invested in her business of making sportswear.

Rosa’s new loan is in the amount of 1000 PEN and will be invested in fabrics, thread, and fasteners. She sells sweatshirts, T-shirts, and polo shirts. Rosa and her husband work together.

Her vision with her business is to acquire more machines and become a company that manufactures track suits. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans and the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, and fasteners for making sportswear

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: H. es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal  Hacienda Chacrasana desde hace 4 meses, ella vende salchipapas, gaseosa, dulces y también realiza recarga de saldo para celulares, todas estas labores las hace en su casa (Chacrasana), inició este negocio con la finalidad de mejorar  su calidad de vida  gracias a los ingresos que le genera  su pequeño negocio ayuda con los gastos de la casa y educación de sus hijos y  a su esposo quien es taxista. H. solicito el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y también un balón de gas más para facilitarse el trabajo. El sueño de aydhe es que sus hijos tengan educación superior.
texts.en:
H. has been serving as President of the “Hacienda Chacrasana” Communal Bank for the past four months. She sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), sodas, and sweets. In addition, she sells rechargeable credits for mobile phones. All of her work is done out of her home (in Chacrasana). H. started this business in order to improve her quality of life. Thanks to the income generated by her small business, she is able to cover the household expenses and pay for her children’s education. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

H. is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO in order to buy more supplies for her business as well as a tank of gas to facilitate her work. Her dream is for her children to pursue a higher education.

loans.use: Purchase supplies & a tank of gas

loans.name: Ruth Ines

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años, de estado civil soltera, la señorita realizo estudios de educación superior.

Hace 02 años trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, con su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas, actualmente vende en un kiosco escolar.

Solicitara un nuevo crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará golosinas, galletas, papa, carne, arroz, verduras, etc., también dice que vende comidas en su kiosco escolar, lo ayuda su hermana.

Su visión en el negocio es tener una sucursal.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the communal bank “3 de Mayo II” (May 3rd II) in Puno District, Puno Province and Puno Department.  She is 20 years old and single.  This young lady completed studies in higher education.

She has been working with "Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos" for two years.  With her first loan, of 300 PEN, she invested in her fruit selling business.  She currently sells from a kiosk in a school.

Ruth is requesting a new loan of 500 PEN ($200 USD) with which she will purchase sweets, crackers, potatoes, meat, rice, vegetables etc.  She tells us that she also sells lunches from her school-based kiosk.  Her sister helps her with the business.

Her vision for her business is to have another branch.

What Ruth likes about her communal bank are the promptness and ease of the loans.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, crackers, potatoes, meat and other products.

loans.name: Sandra Zenobia

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene 03 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja hace más de 08 años con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas, huevo y detergentes para su tienda, es ayudada por sus hijas en cuanto a la atención de la tienda.

Su sueño en el negocio es tener una tienda más grande con locutorios.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la distracción al intercambiar palabras con las socias, el plazo de pagar es rápido y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank “3 de Mayo II” (May 3rd II) in Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department.  She is 44 years old and a single mother of 3 children, all of whom are financially dependent on her.  She completed studies in higher education.

She has been working with "Movimiento Manuela  Ramos" for more than eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her business selling groceries.

Sandra is now requesting a new loan for 1300 PEN ($475 USD), which she will invest in the purchase of sodas, rice, sugar, milk, crackers, eggs and detergents for her store.  Her daughters help her take care of the store.

Her dream for her business is to have a larger store with telephone booths.

What Sandra likes about her communal bank is passing the time chatting with the other members, that the payments are fast and that she earns on her savings.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, like sodas, rice, milk and various other products.

loans.name: Sonia Natividad

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos menores y realizó estudios de educación superior.

La señora se vuelve a reincorporar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer  préstamo  fue  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Ahora solicitará la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el préstamo comprará doce kilos de lana de todo color, confecciona de enaguas, combinaciones, le ayuda sus hijos y su esposo trabaja en Essalud.

Su sueño es sobresalir en el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la buena comunicación con las socias y las charlas que brindan.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member to the "3 de Mayo II" Comunal Bank in the department of Puno. She has completed a higher education. She has lived in common law marriage for 34 years and has two young children.
 
Sonia is a returning borrower of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos group. Her first loan was in the amount of $125 which she invested in her clothing business.
 
She is again requesting a loan of $125. She plans to use the loan to buy 25lbs of wool of a variety of colors, make petticoats and slips [women's traditional clothing in Peru] and help her children and her husband who works for Essalud.
 
Her dream is to excel in business.
 
What Sonia likes about her comunal bank is the good communication with its members and the workshops it offers.

loans.use: To purchase 25 pounds of wool of in a variety of colors

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Félix  tiene 54 años de edad es presidente de la Alcancía Comunal “La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona”, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 25 años, empezó como ambulante a raíz de sus necesidades y por la preocupación  de darles estudios a sus hijos hoy gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación tiene un restaurante en su casa (en la localidad de Corcona) el solicito el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar mas mercaderías o ingredientes para preparar comida se dedica a su trabajo con la finalidad de crear empleo. El sueño de Félix es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales y tener el mejor restaurante de la zona donde vive. Los socios están muy agradecidos por la oportunidad del programa  son serios y responsables en su negocios.
texts.en: Félix is 54 years old. He is the president of the “La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona” [New Hope of Corona] community bank. He has sold food for more than 25 years. He started as a street vendor out of necessity and because he worried about giving his children an education. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, he has a restaurant in his house (in the community of Corcona). He asked for the loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more merchandise, or ingredients, to prepare food. He does his work with the purpose of creating employment. F.' dream is for all of his children to have a profession and to have the best restaurant in the area where he lives. The members are very grateful for the opportunity of the program. They are serious and responsible at their jobs.

loans.use: Merchandise (ingredients) for food

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos (02 dependientes), realizo estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace más de 08 años con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizó para invertir en su negocio de venta de granos, actualmente vente mana.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar trigo, fideos, azúcar, gas, etc., para su negocio venta de mana, lo realizan junto con su esposo.

Su sueño en el negocio es progresar, tener una casa para vivir cómodos y un carro para trasladar la mercadería.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y  la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank “3 de Mayo II”  (May 3rd II) in Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department.  She is 42 years old, married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are dependent.  She completed secondary school.

Sonia has worked with "Movimiento Manuela  Ramos" for more than eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used it to invest in her business selling grains.  She currently sells maná (a Peruvian marzipan-like candy).

Sonia is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN ($550 USD), which she will invest in the purchase of wheat, noodles, sugar, gas etc. for her business selling maná.  She makes the maná together with her husband.

Her dreams are to progress in her business, to have a house so her family can live comfortably and to have a car to aid in transporting their merchandise.

Sonia likes her communal bank's meetings and promptness.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, noodles, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Turatbek

texts.en:
Turatbek B. is 55 years old.  He is married and has four children. After graduating from college and serving in the army, he worked at the local cable plant as an enamel engineer.  After the death of his mother, Turatbek moved into his parents’ house in order to take care of his father. Since his family had been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating, he decided to continue this activity.  He worked hard, but his earnings did not cover all the expenses for his growing children.  

In 2007, Turatbek decided to start his business selling foodstuffs.  This has become an additional source of income for his family.  He sold part of his cattle business and rented a small shop.  To maintain that shop, he obtained his first loan from Bai Tushum. This loan was  used as intended and repaid without any delay. 

Now, Turatbek plans to use this loan for 120,000 KGS to broaden his assortment of goods and renew his shelf stands in the rented shop. In the future, he plans to open his own shop and build a house for his family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that aim to increase employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment for shop
